item.title: [JDK-8337038] Test java/nio/file/attribute/BasicFileAttributeView/CreationTime.java shoud set as /native
item.description:
Test test/jdk/java/nio/file/attribute/BasicFileAttributeView/CreationTime.java invokes CreationTimeHelper in CreationTime.java, and CreationTimeHelper invokes a native function. So test test/jdk/java/nio/file/attribute/BasicFileAttributeView/CreationTime.java should set as /native.
In the PR of backport JDK-8316304 to jdk21u-dev, this test has been rewritten to use JNI instead so as to avoid using Linker API, thus this is specific to jdk21u-dev and jdk17u-dev.
item.summary: Test java/nio/file/attribute/BasicFileAttributeView/CreationTime.java shoud set as /native

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
We execute the whole jdk test tier with "-avm -conc:15 :tier2" , so this might be related , maybe the 2 subtests of CreationTime.java might sometimes be executed in parallel, not sure .
At least I do not see other tests loading the shared lib libCreationTimeHelper.so .
`java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Native Library already loaded in another classloader`, Can you show your reproduce test command

On Linux x86_64 we see now the following error in jdk21u-dev :
test java/nio/file/attribute/BasicFileAttributeView/CreationTime.java#tmp
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Native Library /priv/jvmtests/output_openjdk21_dev_dbgU_linuxx86_64/jtreg/test/jdk/jtreg/native/libCreationTimeHelper.so already loaded in another classloader
at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.NativeLibraries.loadLibrary(NativeLibraries.java:167)
at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.NativeLibraries.loadLibrary(NativeLibraries.java:139)
at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.NativeLibraries.findFromPaths(NativeLibraries.java:259)
at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.NativeLibraries.loadLibrary(NativeLibraries.java:251)
at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:2451)
at java.base/java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:916)
at java.base/java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:2063)
at CreationTimeHelper.<clinit>(CreationTimeHelper.java:26)
at CreationTime.test(CreationTime.java:109)
at CreationTime.main(CreationTime.java:152)
at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DirectMethodHandleAccessor.invoke(DirectMethodHandleAccessor.java:103)
at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:580)
at com.sun.javatest.regtest.agent.MainActionHelper$AgentVMRunnable.run(MainActionHelper.java:333)
at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1583)

Is there some additional adjustment needed ?

[jdk17u-fix-request] Approval Request from sendaoYan
Clean backport [JDK-8337038](https://bugs.openjdk.org/browse/JDK-8337038) to jdk17u-dev, to set the test as `/native`. Trivial fix, no risk.

Changeset: 2c9f741d

Author: SendaoYan <syan@openjdk.org>
Committer: Christoph Langer <clanger@openjdk.org>
Date: 2024-07-30 15:44:21 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u-dev/commit/2c9f741d9ce27cd81e4ad9395a88af1b34a2ba77
This issue is not applicable to main line. The test for JDK-8316304 in main line uses the Linker API. The backport of this feature to 21u has a different test that uses JNI.
removing jdk21u-fix-request label since this is an issue that should first be discussed and resolved in head.

[jdk21u-fix-request] Approval Request from sendaoYan
Set `java/nio/file/attribute/BasicFileAttributeView/CreationTime.java` as `/native`, trivial fix, no risk.

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u-dev/pull/869
Date: 2024-07-24 09:34:23 +0000
[~alanb]Okey, thanks.

[~syan] The JBS to record the versions where an issue has been observed is the "Affects Version/s" field, I've removed it from the JBS title as it is confusing to use it as a prefix in the JBS bug title.

Also would it be possible to put into bug description why you think "/native" is needed? This test doesn't have native code. It does use the Linker API so should run with --enable-native-access=ALL-UNNAMED but not clear why "/native" is needed.

We have disabled a part of an assertion when backporting JDK-8325494 because it requires JDK-8305636 which is not yet in JDK 21u:
https://github.com/openjdk/jdk21u-dev/blob/5c3dbbfc23f96fddf572f52ca2f4441e18d1fd03/src/hotspot/share/opto/loopTransform.cpp#L2052

We should be able to use the old assertion which was removed by JDK-8309902.

item.title: [JDK-8332174] Remove 2 (unpaired) RLO Unicode characters in ff_Adlm.xml
item.description:
I would like to backport to affected update releases this CLDR fix for
"ff_Adlm.xml":

    https://github.com/unicode-org/cldr/pull/3606

The backport would remove two illegal-in-CLDR RIGHT-TO-LEFT OVERRIDE Unicode characters from "make/data/cldr/common/main/ff_Adlm.xml"; these characters are also flagged by one of Red Hat's internal testing tools.

This backport would comprise only two lines of this commit:

commit 1c238d43e81acf516297f26660059d0bab5b5b8a
Author: Naoto Sato <naoto@openjdk.org>
Date: Thu Apr 25 16:19:51 2024 +0000

    8319990: Update CLDR to Version 45.0

    Reviewed-by: joehw, jlu

in the "jdk" repository, which removed the two RLO Unicode characters from "ff_Adlm.xml". The CLDR update also removed from "ff_Adlm.xml" some "zone" and "metazone" elements; I would not backport those changes, or any changes to other files brought in by CLDR version 45.0, just the changes needed to resolve this bug.
item.summary: Remove 2 (unpaired) RLO Unicode characters in ff_Adlm.xml

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

item.description:
Development of update 21.0.5 starts in repository jdk21u-dev on Wednesday May 29th, 2024. The first change should be to bump the version.

Release of 21.0.5 is planned for Tuesday October 15th, 2024.

For the date, see also https://wiki.openjdk.org/display/JDKUpdates/JDK%2021u or https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/
